articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy hit back on Tuesday at Donald Trump's suggestion that Ukraine was responsible for Russia's 2022 full-scale invasion, saying the U.S. president was trapped in a Russian disinformation bubble.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Trump is in disinformation bubble on Ukraine

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: When Russian President Vladimir Putin launched his invasion of Ukraine nearly three years ago, then-U.S. President Joe Biden took a firm stand in solidarity with Kyiv, forged a bulwark of European allies and set veteran advisers to the task of isolating Moscow economically and diplomatically.
articles.title: Major risks loom as Trump upends US Russia policy

articles.author: Kuba Stezycki, Janis Laizans, Alan Charlish
articles.description: Polish call centre worker Katarzyna Paprota, 48, says the dramatic shift in United States policy towards Russia and Ukraine under President Donald Trump gives her reason to fear for the future.
articles.title: On NATO's eastern flank, US policy shift stokes security fears

articles.author: Firas Makdesi, Kinda Makieh
articles.description: For the first time in three decades, Rabbi Joseph Hamra and his son Henry read from a Torah scroll in a synagogue in the heart of Syria's capital Damascus, carefully passing their thumbs over the handwritten text as if still in awe they were back home.
articles.title: After decades in exile, Syria's Jews visit Damascus

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump could meet this month, although the first face-to-face encounter between a Russian and a U.S. leader since 2021 could take longer to prepare, the Kremlin said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Putin-Trump meeting is possible this month but may be later,  Kremlin says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Inside a Thai military camp, four Ethiopian men on Wednesday showed the bruises and scars on their bodies they said were sustained during their time in one of Myanmar's most notorious scam compounds.
articles.title: Myanmar scam centre survivors recall torture and coercion

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt's president called on the international community on Wednesday to adopt a plan to rebuild war-torn Gaza without displacing Palestinians, after a proposal by U.S. President Donald Trump angered Arabs with his own vision for the enclave.
articles.title: Egypt says Gaza should be rebuilt without displacing Palestinians

articles.author: Poppy Mcpherson, Steve Stecklow, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: Aid groups across the world have closed operations, laid off staff and halted life-saving work, including with malnourished children, because of U.S. President Donald Trump’s freeze on foreign assistance, according to a survey of 246 humanitarian organisations.
articles.title: U.S. aid freeze 'decimates' life-saving work globally, survey finds

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: The Trump administration said in a court filing late Tuesday night that it is not disbursing funds for thousands of foreign aid contracts and grants despite a federal judge's order last week to lift a widespread freeze on foreign aid funding.
articles.title: Trump administration keeps USAID contracts frozen despite court order

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe will invest more in security and lead on providing guarantees to Kyiv, but cooperation with Washington to secure peace remains crucial, European leaders said after an emergency meeting held ahead of U.S.-Russia talks on Ukraine.
articles.title: Europe says it is committed to Ukraine ahead of Russia-US talks
